summary: Email correspondence between Jay Lefkowitz and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding draft agreements and a factual proffer related to Jeffrey Epstein's alleged attempts to harass and delay service of process to two individuals in August 2007, in violation of 18 USC 1512(d)(1).

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Email sender working on redline draft agreements and discussing factual basis for allegations against Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Allegedly attempted to harass and delay service of process to two individuals by changing travel plans to the U.S. Virgin Islands in August 2007.

persons.name: Barry
persons.context: Mentioned by the AUSA as someone whose availability needs to be determined for agents to talk to regarding the factual basis of allegations.

persons.name: Lanna
persons.context: Mentioned by the AUSA as someone whose availability needs to be determined for agents to talk to regarding the factual basis of allegations.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is working on draft agreements related to allegations against Epstein, indicating a legal or settlement context.
Both are mentioned together as individuals whose availability needs to be checked for FBI agents to interview regarding the Epstein allegations.

events.title: Epstein's alleged harassment to delay service
events.description: FBI Special Agents traveled to the home of an individual in connection with a Southern District of Florida investigation. Epstein was informed of the service of a subpoena and allegedly attempted to harass and delay two individuals' receipt of process by changing travel plans to fly to the U.S. Virgin Islands instead of New Jersey.

keyFacts: In August 2007, Jeffrey Epstein allegedly attempted to harass and delay two individuals' receipt of a subpoena or official process related to a Southern District of Florida investigation.
Epstein changed travel plans to fly with the two individuals to the U.S. Virgin Islands instead of New Jersey to delay their receipt of process, which may constitute a violation of 18 USC 1512(d)(1).
An Assistant U.S. Attorney states there is no independent evidence of the alleged harassment and that FBI agents need to interview individuals named Barry and Lanna to establish a factual basis.
The email is marked 'Confidential - For settlement purposes only' and involves drafting agreements and a factual proffer related to these allegations.
